question: Which of the followings are not the Negotiable Instruments as defined by the Statute (law)?
explanation: According to Negotiable Instruments Act 1882, Promissory Note, Bill of Exchange and Cheques are the instruments as defined by the statute (law). Banker’s note also performs like a Promissory Note and guaranteed by the government, but Banker’s note is said to be the Negotiable Instruments by custom (trade practices).
